BiblioData.Title: IMPROVED CARBON NANOTUBE BASED SEMICONDUCTING DEVICES AND METHODS FOR THEIR PRODUCTION
BiblioData.Abstract: A method of producing a photo-voltaic device comprising the steps of: synthesising carbon nanotubes; adapting the synthesised carbon nanotubes to provide a surface defect such as to create an effective band gap; selecting an organic semiconductor material which facilitates the efficient energy transfer between carbon nanotubes and the organic material, wherein the organic material is selected such that the energy band gap formed between the HOMO and LUMO energy levels lies within the effective band gap of the adapted carbon nanotubes; combining the adapted carbon nanotubes and the selected organic material to form a composite material.

4. The method of claim 1, wherein energy is transferred between the carbon nanotubes and the organic matrix by the coherent transfer of an electron and hole pair.

7. The method of claim 1 , where energy is transferred by any combination of the energy transfer processes of claims 4 to 6.

15. The method of claim 1, wherein the adaptation step comprises a substitutional doping step.
16. The method of claim 1, wherein the adaptation step comprises a interstitial doping step.

19. The method of claim 18, wherein the organic material is selected from organic materials having a HOMO-LUMO gap less than or equal to 2.8 electron volts.
